item.description:
Come to by far the coolest and most eclectic artisan fair I've ever been to- Harvard Square's holiday fair located in the basement of the First Church in Cambridge. Perfect for gift shopping, you can pick up hand made soap, inexpensive art, organic handmade T shirts, or a tin can cut out to look like a decorative lantern. (note, the fair is secular, its not run by the church so there's no religious parphenilia like Jesus statues or rosarys for sale:)

We're going to gather at Crazy Doughs in Harvard Square (in the Garage) to pregame on pizza and beer/soda, then walk over to the fair. For those so inclined, there's many other places in the square to go shopping for unique gifts afterwards.

Shameless plug, since I'm also running our Frog Pond skating charity event raising money to fufill a wish list for a formerly homeless woman's new apartment through On the Rise, I will be welcoming donations at this event also!
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be inside, Crazy Dough's is lofted above the main entrance
item.name: Harvard Square Holiday Fair---and Lunch before
